items.title: Desperate need for medical evacuations in Gaza as Rafah crossing reopens
items.summary: Only five patients, along with their family members, exited through Rafah on the first day of its reopening, according to ABC staff inside Gaza. Doctors say it does not scratch the surface of the thousands of Palestinians who desperately need medical evacuation.

items.title: Melinda French Gates responds to Bill Gates allegations
items.summary: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

items.title: Former deputy Liberal leader Sam Groth quits Victorian parliament, triggering Nepean by-election
items.summary: Retired tennis star and former deputy Liberal leader Sam Groth will quit Victorian parliament next week, about a month after announcing he would not contest November's state election.

items.title: Police lecture teen caught driving 189km/h on Sunshine Motorway at midnight
items.summary: The teenager on his P-plates was pulled over by police along a Sunshine Coast motorway driving at almost 200km/h.

items.title: P-plater intercepted at high speed on Sunshine Motorway, Mountain Creek
items.summary: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

items.title: $15b National Reconstruction Fund allowed to back 'losers' in push to cut emissions
items.summary: The $15 billion fund will be allowed to back riskier green projects under new rules announced today.

items.title: Report finds NT residents feel less safe and less satisfied with police despite crime crackdown
items.summary: A new report reveals NT residents felt less safe over the past year, despite a government crackdown on crime.

items.title: Diamonds eye timely glimpse of Jamaica in Test series ahead of Commonwealth Games
items.summary: Australia's netballers expect to gain precious intelligence ahead of a showpiece tournament when they host Jamaica in a three-Test series.

items.title: Ban on sand flathead fishing in south-eastern Tasmania amid severe decline in numbers
items.summary: Populations of sand flathead have "severely declined" in Tasmanian waters, prompting the government to close a fishery in the state's south-east to recreational anglers.

items.title: Art exhibitions to see this summer, from Ron Mueck to Hobart Current and Olafur Eliasson
items.summary: From Aussie expat Ron Mueck's hyper-realistic sculptures and Icelandic Danish artist Olafur Eliasson's thought-provoking installations to the best contemporary artists in Tasmania, here are three exhibitions to see.

items.title: Demons defender Steven May misses AFL pre-season training
items.summary: Melbourne Demons veteran Steven May was not at training for his club on Wednesday, just six weeks out from the start of the 2026 AFL season.

items.title: Defence Department announces plans to sell off Leeuwin and Irwin Barracks in Perth
items.summary: The Department of Defence announces plans to sell off both Leeuwin and Irwin barracks, freeing up dozens of hectares of residential land in prime Perth suburbs.

items.title: Up to 100,000 dead fish found on bank of Lake Menindee
items.summary: Residents of a far west New South Wales community found tens of thousands of dead fish on the banks of Lake Menindee.

items.title: Drought-affected SA farmers able to access low-interest loans of up to $250,000
items.summary: The SA government has stepped in with an "unprecedented" offer of direct low-interest loans to farmers hit hard by years of drought.

items.title: Four new rule changes announced for the 2026 NRL season, kick-off tweak to be trialled
items.summary: A proposed rule change to the rugby league kick-off will not be enforced at the start of the 2026 NRL season and will instead be trialled during matches later in the year.

items.title: Government eyes off fire sale of historic defence properties around Australia
items.summary: The Albanese government has identified 67 defence sites for potential sale, aiming to unlock up to $1.8 billion.

items.title: Queensland Police appeal for information as search continues for missing 70-year-old Dawn Wells
items.summary: A large-scale search operation is underway south of Brisbane as police intensify efforts to locate a "beloved community member" who went missing late last year.

items.title: Western Australia's oldest lighthouse at risk from rising sea levels in Geraldton
items.summary: The Point Moore lighthouse has kept seafarers safe along the unforgiving Batavia Coast since 1878, but a maritime historian says there needs to be a firm plan to protect it from future erosion and rising sea levels.

items.title: Travel blogger called out for visit to asbestos-ridden former Wittenoom town site with young daughter
items.summary: Asbestos disease advocates criticise a Queensland blogger for taking her daughter to one of Australia's most contaminated sites.

items.title: Randa Abdel-Fattah to appear at one-off Adelaide literary festival Constellations
items.summary: Palestinian Australian author, lawyer and activist Randa Abdel-Fattah will be appearing at the one-off literary event created to fill the void left by the cancellation of this year's Adelaide Writers' Week, organisers have announced.

items.title: SA Police investigates damage to eight historical graves at Kapunda Cemetery
items.summary: Police are appealing for information about the destruction of historically significant graves north of Adelaide.

items.title: Greens link Hospitality Tasmania's donations to Liberals to pokies card demise
items.summary: The Tasmanian Greens have accused the state's peak hospitality group and the Liberal Party of a "political stitch-up" to kill off the proposed mandatory pokies card, after hundreds of thousands of dollars in donations were revealed.

items.title: Forestry industry sounds alarm over 'cheap' timber imports landing in Australia and threatening jobs
items.summary: Imported timber is coming into Australia at nearly half the price of domestically manufactured products and is increasingly being used in local homes.

items.title: Australia knocked out of under-19 Cricket World Cup by England
items.summary: Ollie Peake's hobbling and defiant captain's knock of 100 has proved too little too late to rescue Australia as their reign as under-19 World Cup champions was ended by England in a compelling semifinal in Zimbabwe.

items.title: ASX climbs after Wall Street's tech sell-off as bitcoin trades around $US76,000 — as it happened
items.summary: The Australian share market edges up after a brutal session on Wall Street, weighed down by massive losses in tech and AI stocks like Nvidia and Microsoft, while bitcoin trades around $76,000 after dropping to a 16-month low.

items.title: 'Rogue' tour guides threaten Gold Coast glow-worm population
items.summary: Last year two operators were fined for running glow-worm cave tours in the Springbrook and Tamborine national parks without the required permits.

items.title: Dr Karl's How Things Work quiz: How much do you really know about guitars?
items.summary: From shaping to tuning — how much do you know about how an acoustic guitar is made?

items.title: Jill Biden's first husband charged with killing wife in domestic dispute at Delaware home
items.summary: William Stevenson is charged with the murder of his wife, Linda Stevenson, at their Delaware home on December 28.

items.title: Extreme heat will make Northern Territory unlivable within 40 years, activists warn
items.summary: The Climate Justice Alliance says rising temperatures and increasingly severe heatwaves present a direct and immediate threat to people across the Territory, particularly in the Top End.

items.title: Donald Trump says Republicans should 'nationalise' US elections
items.summary: Donald Trump says he wants Republicans to "nationalise" US elections and has encouraged his party to "take over the voting" in at least some parts of the country.

items.title: Fire breaks out after alleged ram raid north of Melbourne
items.summary: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

items.title: Brazen ram raid and fire at Mooroopna gift shop caught on camera
items.summary: Police have released footage of a ram raid and fire at a gift shop in the regional town of Mooroopna near Shepparton, north of Melbourne.

items.title: What the Epstein files tell us about Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's 'car crash' 2019 interview
items.summary: Documents released last week have shed more light on what the former prince might have been lying about in that fateful sit-down with the BBC's flagship current affairs program, Newsnight.

items.title: Boost for development of low-emissions alternatives to glass wine bottles
items.summary: The federal government provides $2 million towards developing low-emissions alternatives to glass wine bottles using materials like seaweed and plant sugar.

items.title: Calls for mandatory fire sprinklers in Specialist Disability Accommodation
items.summary: Around the country, people with disability are over-represented in house fire deaths. One simple change could make all the difference.

items.title: Sydney students tackle climate change livability as world records hottest three years
items.summary: The designs include cooling devices for street lights, air-purifying pods for train stations and re-imagined bus shelters to improve livability, after the world records its hottest three years ever.

items.title: How to know if you're experiencing PTSD
items.summary: Louise was experiencing nightmares for five years before being diagnosed with post-traumatic stress disorder.

items.title: Brisbane 2032 looking to learn from Milano Cortina Olympics as costs of dispersed Games start to bite
items.summary: Brisbane 2032 president Andrew Liveris says the bid budget "bears no resemblance to reality" as the financial impact of a dispersed Olympics hits home.

items.title: More than 1.5m AI bots are now socialising on Moltbook — but experts say that's not the scary part
items.summary: A social network run entirely by AI bots has attracted more than a million users — but experts warn it is not what the bots are saying that poses the true risk.

items.title: US forces shoot down Iranian drone near American warship
items.summary: The US military has shot down an Iranian drone that was flying towards an American aircraft carrier in waters near Iran, US authorities say.

items.title: SA Liberals face three major threats in One Nation, a popular premier and independents
items.summary: While South Australia is considered a more moderate state than Queensland or New South Wales, March's state election will still be a chance to gauge the seriousness of One Nation's polling surge and the impact of the Coalition split on the Liberal Party's brand.

items.title: Elite women athletes finding ways to work smarter, to help sporting and professional careers
items.summary: The sport-work-life balance is a struggle faced by many female athletes, but many are finding meaningful ways to diversify their income to secure their future.

items.title: What could the government do to help battle inflation?
items.summary: The federal government has a variety of options available if it wants to do more to stave off inflation, but none are popular.

items.title: RBA rate hike highlights plight of borrowers versus boomers
items.summary: A third of Australians could benefit if banks raise deposit rates on savings, while mortgage holders are having to decide what to cut back on.

items.title: Thousands of parents seek support as children cannot go to school
items.summary: Thousands of Australian parents are struggling with children who cannot go to school. A new podcast and e-book have been released to help support them.

items.title: Officers find signs of forced entry at home of TV host Savannah Guthrie's mother
items.summary: Investigators reportedly found evidence of a deliberate night-time kidnapping at the property.

items.title: UK police open criminal investigation into politician Peter Mandelson over links to Jeffrey Epstein
items.summary: The former UK ambassador to the US will retire from Britain's parliament as police open a criminal investigation over his ties to the late paedophile.

items.title: Poland to probe links between Epstein and Russian intelligence
items.summary: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk says the step has been taken amid growing speculation that "this unprecedented paedophilia scandal was co-organised by Russian intelligence services".

items.title: Australian freestyle skier Laura Peel hurts knee in Winter Olympics training camp
items.summary: Australian freestyle skier Laura Peel hurt her knee in a training camp ahead of the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics, raising doubts about her participation in a fourth Games.

items.title: Luxury Gnarabup Development granted approval by WA Environment Minister Matthew Swinbourn
items.summary: A controversial $138 million luxury resort slated for construction in WA's South West is given a long-anticipated green light by the state's environment minister.

items.title: French police raid X offices in Paris as Elon Musk ordered to face questions
items.summary: A widening probe into the social media platform is investigating alleged abuse of algorithms and fraudulent data extraction.

items.title: Russia resumes strikes on Ukraine, leaving hundreds of thousands without heating in freezing temperatures
items.summary: The 71 missiles and 450 drones came a day before Ukrainian and Russian negotiators were due to meet for a second round of talks in Abu Dhabi.

items.title: To stop the rate hikes, Chalmers might have to ditch the 'I didn't do it' game
items.summary: When the news broke that rates would increase, the treasurer's main priority was to prove it wasn't his fault. That won't satisfy voters.

items.title: Commissioner slams attempts to use complex needs as 'justification' for Mosman Park murder-suicides
items.summary: Australia's disability discrimination commissioner condemns "dangerous narratives" surrounding the deaths of teenage brothers Leon and Otis Clune, saying the burden of disability should never be a justification for family violence.

items.title: Central Coast Mariners star Annalise Rasmussen signs with Italian powerhouse Juventus
items.summary: A-League leading goal scorer Annalise Rasmussen leaves the competition immediately to join Italian powerhouse Juventus.

items.title: Commonwealth, Westpac, NAB, ANZ respond to RBA's interest rate hike
items.summary: The Commonwealth Bank responds to the Reserve Bank of Australia's decision to increase the cash rate.

items.title: Nightmare on Martin Place as RBA outlines horror interest rates scenario
items.summary: The good news is the economy ended 2025 in relatively good shape — with growth starting to pick up, the economy transitioning away from government-led spending, and a historically strong jobs market. Unfortunately, that's where it ends.

items.title: Water Corporation makes 'error' in early publication of new desalination plant location in Albany
items.summary: The long-anticipated decision on a site for a desalination plant near Albany has been shared on the Water Corporation's webpage in an "administrative error" ahead of the official announcement.

items.title: 'Spas' and 'saunas' used to reintroduce green and golden bell frogs to the ACT in world-first trial
items.summary: Scientists are reintroducing hundreds of green and golden bell frogs into the ACT, nearly 50 years after they became locally extinct.

items.title: 'Mass exodus' from Cambodian scam compounds a 'humanitarian crisis'
items.summary: Cambodia has witnessed a "mass exodus" from the country's online scam operations in recent weeks amid growing international pressure and the extradition to China of an alleged kingpin.

items.title: Austin Appelbee speaks after 'superhuman' swim off Quindalup to save family in Geographe Bay
items.summary: A WA mother says asking her teenage son to swim 4 kilometres through rough seas to get help after their family was swept out to sea, was "one of the hardest decisions" she has ever made.

items.title: Sydney Mardi Gras pulls plug on party weeks out from parade
items.summary: Chief executive of the Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras, Jesse Matheson, announced the post-parade celebration will not go ahead.

items.title: Australian Nurse working in Gaza for MSF says looming ban on aid organisation 'abandons' vulnerable
items.summary: Broome nurse Rebecca Smith says a looming ban on Doctors Without Borders due to registration issues will harm the most needy patients.

items.title: Federal parliament condemns attempted bombing at Perth/Boorloo Invasion Day rally
items.summary: Federal parliament officially condemns the attempted bomb attack at Perth's Invasion Day rally on its first sitting day, acknowledging the harm caused to the First Nations community.

items.title: Missing bushwalker David Elliot found after large-scale search in the Blue Mountains
items.summary: Authorities have found 71-year-old David Elliot alive following a multi-agency search when he failed to return from a 30-kilometre walk.
